Description: Terracotta figure fragment. Cypriot yellow-buff marl clay with abundant very fine black or dark grey (volcanic?), red or brown (grog?) inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ18 (likely)
Curator's comments: This figurine is labelled in pencil T 18 Φ (however the first and last characters are obscured and unclear). This is then most likely part of a group of Cypriot terracotta and limestone figures were sent by the Egypt Exploration Fund in 1911 to the British Museum and various other museums including this one. Many of these were labelled T, Φ, or TAΦ, followed by a context number, designating these as coming from a context within the sanctuary of Aphrodite, from Gardner’s excavations in 1885-1886. This is also confirmed by British Museum registers. This figure is from this group and so highly likely to have been excavated within the temenos of the Aphrodite sanctuary.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.114) (Phase 3)
